name: Palmier
headline: AI Native Github Alternative
description:
Code repositories are built for humans to understand and collaborate on code. But soon, they‚Äôll be used primarily by AIs working on our behalf. As this shift happens, the structure and processes around code must evolve.

At Palmier, we‚Äôre building a new kind of code repository designed for AIs. Every line of code has a history behind it, and we‚Äôre making that history accessible for AIs to create more efficient and reliable code, aligned with human intention.

Our first product is a platform that helps developers work seamlessly with AI, improving efficiency. We aim to provide an API for any AI to interact with code, giving it the information needed to produce better quality code.

Reach out at founders@palmier.io

founders.name: Marcos Rico Peng, Founder
founders.description: After graduating Berkeley in three years, I worked for a year and a half as an infra engineer at LinkedIn. Now co-founder and CEO of Palmier, building something people want! Documented my journey as a professional swimmer training to make the Paris Olympics on YouTube [143k+].

founders.name: Harrison Tin, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder of Palmier. 

Previously Software Engineer at Microsoft. Studied EECS at UC Berkeley.

# Your AI-Powered GitHub Issue Solver
Tag @|
Simply tag `@palmier-bot solve` in any GitHub issue and watch as our AI agent solves it with a perfectly crafted pull request.
Try PalmierSchedule Demo
## Performance optimization needed for data processing pipeline
#247
Openlokithedev opened this issue 1 hour ago2 comments
Overview
L
lokithedevopened this issue 1 hour ago
@palmier-bot The data processing pipeline is taking too long to complete. We are seeing significant slowdowns when processing large datasets.
‚Ä¢ Processing time increases exponentially with dataset size ‚Ä¢ CPU usage spikes during transformation steps ‚Ä¢ Memory consumption is higher than expected
Can we optimize this for better performance?
performanceoptimizationpipeline
P
palmier[bot]15 minutes ago
I've analyzed the pipeline and created a pull request with performance optimizations: #248
‚Ä¢ Optimized data transformation in pipeline/transform.py:
‚Ä¢ Implemented parallel processing for large datasets ‚Ä¢ Added batch processing to reduce memory usage
‚Ä¢ Enhanced caching mechanism:
‚Ä¢ Added intermediate results caching ‚Ä¢ Optimized memory management for large operations
These changes should reduce processing time by ~60% for large datasets. Ready for review! üöÄ

Instant Issue ResolutionDeep Context UnderstandingAutomated Pull Requests
Instant Issue Resolution
## Tag @palmier-bot solve in any GitHub issue
Our AI agent deeply analyzes your entire codebase to provide solutions that integrate seamlessly with your existing architecture and patterns.
Deep Context Understanding
## AI that understands your codebase
Palmier creates complete, well-documented pull requests that solve your issues. Each PR comes with detailed explanations and follows your project's conventions.
Automated Pull Requests
## From issue to PR in minutes
Additionally, use our powerful IDE integration to review and understand code changes faster with AI-powered explanations and summaries.
## What Can Palmier Bot Do?
Simply tag the bot with the right command in your GitHub issues and pull requests.
üöÄ
### Solve Issues
`@palmier-bot solve`
Tag the bot in any issue and it will analyze your codebase to create a perfectly crafted PR that solves the problem.
üìù
### Describe PRs
`@palmier-bot describe`
Get an AI-generated summary of any pull request that highlights key changes and their impact.
üîç
### Review PRs
`@palmier-bot review`
Get an in-depth code review that analyzes code quality, performance, and security implications.
PR Review Platform
### Review PRs Like You Write Code
Experience a new way to review pull requests with our IDE-powered platform. Get instant AI-generated summaries, in-line explanations, and smart suggestions.
  * AI-generated PR summaries that highlight key changes and potential impacts
  * IDE-like environment with syntax highlighting and navigation
  * AI-powered chat inside your PR to understand changes and merge faster


Try PR Review Platform
![Palmier IDE Integration](https://www.palmier.io/_next/image?url=%2FIDEInterface.png&w=1920&q=75)
## Ready to Ship Better Code?
Join the teams using Palmier to transform their development workflow. No setup required.
Try Palmier Bot
Book a Demo

generated_description:
### Palmier: Your AI-Powered GitHub Alternative

**Mission**: Palmier is on a mission to reimagine code repositories for an AI-driven future. As code becomes increasingly managed by AI rather than humans, the entire structure and processes surrounding it need to evolve. Palmier aims to be at the forefront of this evolution. 

**Background**: Founded in 2024 and currently part of Y Combinator‚Äôs Batch S24, Palmier started with a simple premise: create code repositories that are fundamentally built for human understanding and collaboration. But, with AI becoming a critical player in coding, Palmier is pivoting to facilitate this transition, designing repositories specifically for AI efficiency and reliability. 

**Product Offering**: Their flagship platform empowers developers by integrating seamlessly with AI, enabling enhanced productivity. At the core of Palmier's offering is an API designed for any AI to interact with code, allowing AIs to access the historical context of code and thus deliver higher quality, more reliable programming solutions. 

**How It Works**: One standout feature is the ability to tag `@palmier-bot solve` in GitHub issues. This triggers Palmier's AI to analyze the associated codebase and generate a well-crafted pull request (PR) in response to the issue. Whether it's optimizing performance in a processing pipeline or identifying key changes in PRs, Palmier's AI capabilities aim to streamline the workflow for developers.

**Team**: Based in San Francisco, Palmier operates with a tight-knit team of two, showcasing an agile approach to innovation. The team benefits from the guidance of Michael Seibel, a prominent partner at Y Combinator, nudging them towards successful growth in the competitive tech landscape.

**Clientele & Partnerships**: Trusted by engineers from notable organizations like Microsoft, LinkedIn, and UC Berkeley, Palmier is quickly establishing itself as a reliable resource for modern development teams seeking to navigate the evolving coding environment.

**Get Involved**: Interested developers can dive in and experience Palmier's offerings firsthand‚Äîa demo can be requested directly from their website [palmier.io](https://www.palmier.io), or reach out via email at founders@palmier.io.

As the coding landscape shifts, Palmier isn‚Äôt just keeping pace; it‚Äôs leading the charge towards a future where developers and AI collaborate more effectively than ever before.
